Question
========
Which of the following commands will install the **lavaan** package from CRAN?

Answerlist
----------
* `install.packages("lavaan")`
* `install.packages("lavaan", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org")`
* `install.packages("lavaan", lib = "~/R/my_packages/")`
* `install.packages("dplyr")`
* `install.packages("dplyr", repos = "https://cloud.r-project.org")`
* `remotes::install_github("yrosseel/lavaan")`
* `library(lavaan)`
* `ls(lavaan)`
* `help(lavaan)`

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* Correct: The simple case
* Correct: Explicitly specifying the CRAN mirror to use
* Correct: Installing from CRAN, but installing into a non-standard library location
* Wrong: Installing **dplyr**
* Wrong: Installing **dplyr**
* Wrong: Installing the development version of **lavaan** from GitHub
* Wrong: Loading the package, not installing
* Wrong: This is a misuse of the `ls()` function
* Wrong: Accessing the help file for the `lavaan()` function
